alert.note: Alert for Adams; Idaho; Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued March 14 at 9:51PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Payette National Forest Avalanche Center. ...The Payette National Forest Avalanche Center in McCall Idaho has issued a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING... * WHAT...The avalanche danger for the warning area is HIGH. * WHERE...in the West Central Idaho Mountains, the mountains near the communities of McCall, New Meadows, Donnelly, and Cascade. * WHEN...in effect Tuesday, March 14, 2023 9:30 pm MDT until Wednesday, March 15, 2023 9:30 pm MDT. * IMPACTS...Heavy snowfall combined with strong winds is overloading the current snowpack. High avalanche danger is expected through Wednesday evening. Large avalanches will become very likely in many areas. Rain on snow is creating unstable snow below 7000 feet. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Very dangerous avalanche conditions. Travel in avalanche terrain is not recommended. Avoid slopes steeper than 30 degrees and avoid being near or underneath slopes steeper than 30 degrees. Avalanches may run long distances and can run into mature forests, valley floors or flat terrain. Consult WWW.PAYETTEAVALANCHE.ORG or WWW.AVALANCHE.ORG for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
